message: This problem also exists with groups -- I'd like to have a warning that the group I am creating exists already, instead of simply uniquifying it.
so for example if url for this thread was https://convore.com/feedback/deaf-lets-eliminate-topic-url-vanity/
as an aside I often use a timestamp as a unique id for various datastore projects.
I searched for "devops" and just got one message result, so I created a devops group, only to realize that it had created devops-1, and devops *did* exist.
so i guess this is a request for search to search group names, too. /cc @ericflo
@georgalis I believe @ericflo has mentioned somewhere that the problem of group duplication / merging existing groups is something they are looking into.

actually I really meant group url vanity... I don't want mycompany-3 for a new group; I'd rather have $RANDOM-mycompany.  Likewse if a group already exists I'd like the option to join it (or one of them) verses create a new one.

@steveivy Actually, you can search for groups by name. Go to "Discover" at the top, choose "Search for groups" on the left, and you can search by name. I'll +1 your point though that this should be in the upper right-hand search box available on all pages (that's where I first looked to search and I've heard others mentioning the same)
@michaelschade Yup - I've seen it mentioned but in a slightly different context
